result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case in court for justice point violation. Court admonishes defendant and advises of last warning. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.

Defendant Deonta Lamont Jones in court.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas in court for Deonta Lamont Jones.  Attorney John Rejowski for Catelin Ringersma in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status of counsel. Defense requests more time to review case. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.

received and filed.

Defendant Deonta Lamont Jones in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora by Christopher Hartley as friend of the court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin via zoom. Defense counsel will have discovery ready for next counsel. Defendant to retain his own new counsel.  Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing in Branch 4 on 8/2/22 at 8:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report dated 4-14-2022; Received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review. 

Court will address at next hearing.

Defendant Deonta Lamont Jones in court with Attorney Fred Richardson; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 14CF2608. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Lopez.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for Level 4 supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test and portable breathalyzers. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES  QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
